examples: The convention was held in Geneva.

definitions.definition: A formal deliberative assembly of mandated delegates.
examples: The EU installed an inter-institutional Convention to draft a European constitution.

definitions.definition: The convening of a formal meeting.
A formal agreement , contract , rule , or pact .
A treaty or supplement to such.
examples: The Vienna convention at the Vienna Congress (1814-15) standardized most of diplomatic conduct for generations.

definitions.definition: A practice or procedure widely observed in a group, especially to facilitate social interaction ; a custom .
examples: Table seatings are generally determined by tacit convention , not binding formal protocol.
The convention of driving on the right is reinforced by law.

secondary_definitions: A formal deliberative assembly of mandated delegates.
The convening of a formal meeting.
A formal agreement , contract , rule , or pact .
( international law ) A treaty or supplement to such.
A practice or procedure widely observed in a group, especially to facilitate social interaction ; a custom .
